name: Journey to the Heart of the Hidden Words (with Community BBQ)
shortDescription: Join us on a journey to explore the profound meanings hidden in the Hidden Words, followed by a fun community
fullDescription:
Experience the transformative power of God's love song to humanity!

Immerse yourself in this rare opportunity to explore one of the Bahá'í Faith's most profound mystical treasures. The Hidden Words isn't just sacred text—it's a divine invitation to transform your daily life and gain deep wisdom on the journey of your soul.

This weekend of discovery will help you to:

Experience exclusive video presentations by renowned Bahá'í scholars Dr. Julio Savi and Dr. John Hatcher;Uncover the historical context that brings these sacred passages to life;Engage in intimate small group discussions that reveal personal insights and form meaningful bonds with fellow spiritual seekers;Participate in soul-nourishing devotionals and creative artistic expression.

Previous participants from 2024 describe the experience as life-changing: "It will set you on fire!" and "My spirit is so light and happy."

Ms. Zarrín Caldwell is organizing the retreat. She traveled with her father (Jenabe Caldwell) who included The Hidden Words in spiritualization institutes that he gave globally for many years, and which transformed their participants in aiming for new levels of love, virtue, and service.

On Sunday afternoon (Oct. 12) members of local Bahá’í assemblies will be invited to join our gathering for a BBQ lunch and final session.

- 8:00 - 9:00 AM - Breakfast

- 2:00 - 6:00 PM - Sessions

- 6:00 - 7:00 PM - Dinner

Introduction to Desert Rose Winter and Spring Programs:
Our winter and spring retreats at Desert Rose focus on the in-depth study of core spiritual literature and historical texts. Set in the serene desert environment of Arizona, we enjoy a perfect winter retreat environment. These programs provide ain ideal opportunity for reflection, learning, and community engagement.

Fees, Prerequisites, and Materials:
Attendees are required to register in advance, with fees covering all sessions, meals, and materials. Specific prerequisites for participation and a list of materials to be studied will be provided upon registration.

Registration:
Registration includes 6 meals, materials and accommodations in our dormitory. If you would prefer to rent a private apartment, these can be booked separately using the link bit.ly/drbi-rentals. Apartments fill up quickly and are available on a first-come, first-serve basis, so book quickly.

If apartments are full and you prefer not to stay in the dormitory, here is a list of nearby hotels.

Alternatively, we have boondocking-style RV parking for guests and volunteers at no additional cost. These have no power or hookups, just a water and dump station.

Transportation:

DRBI does not yet own a shuttle van but numerous shuttle and Uber options exist from the Phoenix airport only 45 minutes away.

Donations:

Support for our programs is greatly appreciated, and additional donations can be made to help us continue offering these enriching experiences. https://givebutter.com/drbiffa
